name: HUNTS - XSL Script Processing (T1220)
description: Detects process execution via the use of XSL scripts. XSL scripts can allow a user to bypass application whitelisting by executing code through trusted OS binaries.

steps.name: Create and Link MSXSL Alert

arguments.comment: SIEM query identified XSL script execution via process {{vars.item.process_exec}} on {{vars.item.host}} at {{vars.item.TimeCreated}}.
arguments.alertName: ATT&CK-XSL Script Processing-{{vars.item.process_exec}} executed a .XSL file
arguments.description: An attempt to invoke an XSL script from the command line was observed. XSL can be used to execute arbitrary code via trusted binary execution. Use of this technique may bypass application whitelisting and allow an attacker to bypass other defenses. Attention should be paid to the commands passed as well as processes spawned.

steps.name: Copy2 of Create and Link MSXSL Alert

arguments.comment: SIEM query identified XSL script execution via process {{vars.item._source.image_path.split("\\")[-1] }} on {{vars.item._source.beat.hostname}} at {{vars.item._source.event_data.UtcTime}}.
arguments.description: An attempt to invoke an XSL script from the command line was observed. XSL can be used to execute arbitrary code via trusted binary execution. Use of this technique may bypass application whitelisting and allow an attacker to bypass other defenses. Attention should be paid to the commands passed  as well as processes spawned.

steps.name: Copy  of Create and Link WMIC Alert

arguments.comment: SIEM query identified invocation on an XSL script via WMIC on {{vars.item._source.beat.hostname}} at {{vars.item._source.event_data.UtcTime}}.
arguments.description: An attempt to invoke an XSL script using WMIC was observed. XSL can be used to execute arbitrary code via trusted binary execution. Use of this technique may bypass application whitelisting and allow an attacker to bypass other defenses. Attention should be paid to the commands passed as well as processes spawned.

steps.name: Splunk query for MSXSL XSL Script Processing

params.query: index=sysmon EventCode=1 {{vars.splunkHuntStart}} {{vars.splunkHuntEnd}} CommandLine="*.xsl*" OR Product="Command Line XSLT" OR Image="*.msxsl.exe" Image!="C:\\Windows\\System32\\wbem\\WMIC.exe" Image!="C:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\wbem\\WMIC.exe" | table host Image MD5 ParentImage User CommandLine process_exec vendor_product TimeCreated ParentProcessId ProcessId ParentCommandLine ProcessGuid UtcTime EventChannel Computer

steps.name: Elastic query for WMIC XSL Script Processing

params.query: event_type:sysmon AND event_id:1 AND @timestamp:{ {{vars.elasticHuntStart}} TO {{vars.elasticHuntEnd}} } AND (image_path:"C:\\Windows\\System32\\wbem\\WMIC.exe" OR image_path:"C:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\wbem\\WMIC.exe") AND event_data.CommandLine:*.xsl*

steps.name: Get Results 3
Copy 1 of Copy  of Create and Link WMIC Alert

arguments.comment: SIEM query identified an XSL script in the command line, leading to spawning of child process {{vars.item._source.image_path.split("\\")[-1]}} on {{vars.item._source.beat.hostname}} at {{vars.item._source.event_data.UtcTime}}.
arguments.description: An attempt to invoke an XSL script from the command line resulting in the spawning of a child process was observed. XSL scripts can be used to execute arbitrary code via trusted binary execution. Use of this technique may bypass application whitelisting and allow an attacker to bypass other defenses. Attention should be paid to the commands passed as well as processes spawned.

steps.name: Elastic query for MSXSL XSL Script Processing

arguments.name: ElasticSearch

params.query: event_type:sysmon AND event_id:1 AND @timestamp:{ {{vars.elasticHuntStart}} TO {{vars.elasticHuntEnd}} } AND (event_data.CommandLine:*.xsl* OR event_data.Product:"Command Line XSLT" OR image_path:"*msxsl.exe") NOT (image_path:"C:\\Windows\\System32\\wbem\\WMIC.exe" OR image_path:"C:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\wbem\\WMIC.exe")

steps.name: Create and Link WMIC Alert

arguments.comment: SIEM query identified invocation on an XSL script via WMIC, which spawned child process {{vars.item.process_exec}} on {{vars.item.host}} at {{vars.item.TimeCreated}}.
arguments.alertName: ATT&CK-XSL Script Processing-{{vars.item.process_exec}} executed a .XSL file
arguments.description: An attempt to invoke an XSL script using WMIC was observed. XSL can be used to execute arbitrary code via trusted binary execution. Use of this technique may bypass application whitelisting and allow an attacker to bypass other defenses. Attention should be paid to the commands passed as well as processes spawned.

steps.name: Hunt for XSL Script Processing

arguments.title: T1220 - Hunt for XSL Script Processing

steps.name: Create and Link Child Process Alert

arguments.comment: SIEM query identified an XSL script in the command line, leading to spawning of child process {{vars.item.process_exec}} on {{vars.item.host}} at {{vars.item.TimeCreated}}.
arguments.alertName: ATT&CK-XSL Script Processing-{{vars.item.process_exec}} was spawned from execution of a .XSL file
arguments.description: An attempt to invoke an XSL script from the command line resulting in the spawning of a child process was observed. XSL scripts can be used to execute arbitrary code via trusted binary execution. Use of this technique may bypass application whitelisting and allow an attacker to bypass other defenses. Attention should be paid to the commands passed as well as processes spawned.

steps.name: Deduplicate Comments
Set Elastic hunt times
Which SIEM
Get Results 2
Splunk query for WMIC XSL Script Processing

params.query: index=sysmon EventCode=1 {{vars.splunkHuntStart}} {{vars.splunkHuntEnd}} (Image="C:\\Windows\\System32\\wbem\\WMIC.exe" OR Image="C:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\wbem\\WMIC.exe") AND CommandLine="*.xsl*" | table host Image MD5 ParentImage User CommandLine process_exec vendor_product TimeCreated ParentProcessId ProcessId ParentCommandLine ProcessGuid UtcTime EventChannel Computer

Hunt for XSL Script Processing -> Which SIEM
Copy 1 of Copy  of Create and Link WMIC Alert -> Deduplicate Comments
Set Elastic hunt times -> a
Elastic query for Child Processes via  XSL Script Processing -> Copy 1 of Copy  of Create and Link WMIC Alert
Create and Link Child Process Alert -> Deduplicate Comments
Which SIEM -> Set Splunk hunt times

routes.name: Copy  of Get Results for Sysmon -> Copy  of Create and Link Alert
Elastic query for WMIC XSL Script Processing -> Copy  of Create and Link WMIC Alert
Set Splunk hunt times -> Splunk query for WMIC XSL Script Processing
